Package assn3

Class Assignment3

java.lang.Object
assn3.Assignment3
public class Assignment3 extends Object
The Assignment3 class contains the main method, which serves as the entry point in the production environment. It manages recipes using the RecipeManager class and provides functionalities to view recipes, create shopping lists, and print or save shopping lists.
Since:
JDK 17.0.10
Version:
1.0
Author:
Xin Wang

  • Field Details

    • choices

      private static final MenuOption[] choices
      An array of MenuOption enum values representing all possible menu choices.

  • Constructor Details

    • Assignment3

      public Assignment3()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method serves as the entry point for the Assignment3 class in the production environment. It initializes the RecipeManager, loads recipes, and manages user interactions.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments.

    • getRequest

      private static MenuOption getRequest(Scanner input)
      The getRequest method displays the menu containing options and prompts the user to select an option. It validates user input to ensure it is within the acceptable range (0-4).
      Parameters:
      input - The Scanner object used to read user input.
      Returns:
      The MenuOption The enum value corresponding to the user's selection.

    • showRecipes

      private static void showRecipes(RecipeManager manager)
      The showRecipes method displays all available recipes along with their numbers. The Recipes are numbered from 1 to n, where n is the total number of recipes.
      Parameters:
      manager - The RecipeManager object containing the recipes.

    • createShoppingList

      private static void createShoppingList(RecipeManager manager, Scanner input)
      The createShoppingList method allows the user to order a specific type of bread by selecting a recipe number and quantity. It validates user input to ensure the recipe number is within range and the quantity is positive. It prevents negative orders by checking if the total quantity would be negative.
      Parameters:
      manager - The RecipeManager object containing the recipes.
      input - The Scanner object used to read user input.

    • orderRecipe

      private static boolean orderRecipe(List<Recipe> recipes, int recipeNumber, int orderingQuantity)
      The orderRecipe method updates the ordered quantity for a specific recipe. It ensures that the total quantity after the update is not negative.
      Parameters:
      recipes - The list of Recipe objects.
      recipeNumber - The number of the recipe to order.
      orderingQuantity - The quantity to add to the current order.
      Returns:
      true if the order was successful, false if it would result in a negative quantity.

    • printShoppingList

      private static void printShoppingList(RecipeManager manager, Scanner input)
      The printShoppingList method prints the shopping list and asks the user if they want to save it to a file. If the user enters "Y", the shopping list will be saved.
      Parameters:
      manager - The RecipeManager object used to save the shopping list.
      input - The Scanner object used to read user input.

    • generateShoppingList

      private static List<String> generateShoppingList(RecipeManager manager)
      The generateShoppingList method generates a shopping list based on the ordered recipes. The shopping list includes the names and quantities of ordered recipes, as well as the total quantities of ingredients needed. It only shows recipes and ingredients with non-zero quantities.
      Parameters:
      manager - The RecipeManager object containing the recipes.
      Returns:
      A List of Strings representing the shopping list.
